result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Harden

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing for Jerry Harden returned. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.
Due to a conflict in the courts calendar the PTC of 10/17/22 at 1:30 has been adjourned to 11/07/22 at 3:30
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss all Criminal Charges filed by DE pro se
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of Attorney Chaves the PTC of 09/07/22 at 2:30 has been reset to 10/17/22 at 1:30.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chavez.  Clerk. M.Burke. ADA Binger states that the state will be moving to dismiss 22CF914 at the next scheduled hearing in that matter andwill file an amended information in this case.  Attorney Chavez states he needs some time to discuss and explain this to the DE. Court holds off on entering the amended information to the case. Attorney Chavez's bond motion. For reasons set forth on the record court denies the bond motion.  PTC set to 09/07/22 at 2:30.
to Review Bond filed by Atty Jeremy Chavez.
DE is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

Defendant Jerry Harden appeared with Attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
